title: Hotel Check-in & Check-out
description: Practice English conversations for hotel stays

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: Good afternoon, do you have a reservation?

options.text: Yes, under the name of Johnson.

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: How many nights will you be staying?

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: Would you like a room with a view?

options.text: Yes, if possible. How much extra is it?

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: Breakfast is served from 7 to 10 AM.

options.text: Thank you for letting me know.
I want to see the menu.

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: Your room is 305 on the third floor.

options.text: Thank you. Where are the elevators?

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: What time would you like a wake-up call?

options.text: 7 AM would be perfect, thank you.

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: Is everything satisfactory with your room?

options.text: Yes, everything is fine, thank you.

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: Would you like to extend your stay?

options.text: The hippos are in the water.
No, I'll be checking out tomorrow.

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: What time will you be checking out?

options.text: I want to try the chocolate cake.

questions.speaker: Receptionist
questions.text: Here is your bill. How would you like to pay?

options.text: I'd like a table for two.
By credit card, please. Thank you for everything.
